existing_features.title: Create a public-facing school website for the upper primary school named “Raghunathganj Sarada Bidyapith” with standard informational sections: Home, About, Academics, Admissions, Notice Board/Announcements, Events, Staff/Teachers, Gallery, and Contact.
Implement an admin authentication flow using Internet Identity and restrict admin features to an allowlisted set of administrator principals stored in the backend.

Add an admin dashboard that allows admins to create, edit, publish/unpublish, reorder, and delete editable website content for: Announcements, Events, Staff entries, Gallery images, and key site settings (school address, phone, email, office hours).
Use React Query on the frontend to fetch public content and to manage admin mutations, including loading/error states and optimistic/refresh behavior appropriate for admin edits.

Define and apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme suitable for an upper primary school website (avoid blue/purple), including typography, colors, spacing, and reusable section layouts, and apply it consistently across all pages and the admin area.

Add a footer with key links and school contact details, and include a simple Contact page that displays the editable Site Settings plus a non-sending contact form (client-side only) with clear messaging that the form does not submit externally.
Generate and include static image assets for the site branding and homepage visuals, and render them from the frontend as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Replace the current header logo image with the user-uploaded logo image ("Logo HD round cropped.jpeg") by adding an optimized static logo asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and updating the header to reference the new asset instead of "/assets/generated/school-logo.dim_512x512.png".
Update the /admin access denied experience to help the user find/copy their Internet Identity principal and, when bootstrap is available, allow them to become the first admin from the UI.
Re-run the full build and deployment process for the current application revision (frontend + backend) and ensure it completes successfully.
If deployment fails again, capture and surface the complete deployment error output (including the failing step and stack/error message) so it can be addressed in a follow-up change.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a school website for Raghunathganj Sarada Bidyapith with editable content/features (admin-editable pages/sections).
Persist all editable content in the Motoko backend with stable storage so content remains after canister upgrades, and expose query/update methods needed by the frontend.
Replace the site logo with the user-provided (given) picture/logo asset.

Replace the site header logo with the newly uploaded image file "Logo HD round cropped-1.jpeg" by generating an optimized, round-cropped, transparent PNG logo asset at 512x512 under "frontend/public/assets/generated" and ensuring the header uses that asset at "/assets/generated/school-logo-uploaded.dim_512x512.png".
Add the user's Internet Identity principal to the backend admin allowlist so they can access /admin and edit the website (resolve Access Denied).

Implement a safe admin allowlist bootstrap so the site can be edited when no administrators are configured: if the admin allowlist is empty, allow the first authenticated caller to add themselves as an admin; once at least one admin exists, only existing admins can add/remove other admins.

Expose backend methods needed by the frontend to (a) read whether admin bootstrap is available and (b) read the caller principal in a displayable text format, without granting admin privileges by default.

Add the Internet Identity principal "xfz3b-e67hi-f3hzj-rhwom-7mwwe-qfwub-44lyr-ojgc3-xh4rp-urycv-fqe" to the backend admin allowlist so this identity is recognized as an administrator and can edit the website via /admin.

Ensure the first-admin bootstrap prompt is no longer available once at least one admin exists (including after adding the provided principal), so non-admin users do not see the "Become Admin (First-Time Setup)" call-to-action.
